intro: Stichorkis decursiva, commonly known as the creeping daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Stichorkis decursiva is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in rock gardens or as ground cover.
